text:
Hi all, using the JSON api, how can I know the column names on a row? we have a lot of boolean flags that have been added with time, and it’s hard to know what’s what since the data comes in an array

Maybe there’s an endpoint that returns an object with named properties?
we do not have at this time. You need to get the table details and map yourself.
fields are showing and then not showing as i sit and refresh my browser...
from the front end that is

<@U6GNQ7JBU> is the ability to use H tags in the rich text field on the roadmap? (or even just view/edit source)... My client has a lot of dynamically generated product pages and they're concerned about the lack of heading tags in the body from an SEO perspective which i agree with
cc <@UG52C29EE> I don’t work on HubDB anymore
We have been thinking adding some of those features to hubdb ui. Meanwhile can u use different column for product headings and format it in html after getting the data via hubl
<@U24GZQ3GF> thats weird. can u send me the details with links?
yeah that was my suggestion to the client but he wants to be able to us h2s and h3s in the body which has variable content/structure from product to product
in a perfect world we'd never use rich text with a database anyway :wink: rich text = non structed

I managed to get one working with three filters, which was good since I've already contracted with a client to build the same for them... :hushed:
<http://HubSpot-developers-2yb9ww-5121650.hs-sites.com/real-estate-listing>
That's awesome! I'm glad you were able to figure out a solution. How were you able to work out the additional filters?
